content.content: image1920×897 85.8 KB  This is a big step, as it is one of the most important EVMs today. We know that Terra recently acquired 200 million worth of its AVAX token. But as we pointed out in their Bridge Contract https://etherscan.io/token/0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f?a=0xe78388b4ce79068e89bf8aa7f218ef6b9ab0e9d0 https://etherscan.io/address/0xe78388b4ce79068e89bf8aa7f218ef6b9ab0e9d0 they have more than 800 Million DAI. It would be interesting to see an approach, to allow it to be a type of collateral, indirectly they are betting on the lower risk for the growth of these EVMs. In the case of Matic and possibly GNO (formerly xDAI), if all goes well, I would like to see Maker take on this type of guarantee for large EVMs such as Fantom, Avax, Matic, GNO, Osmosis, Harmony or KLAY. Obviously, following the parameters that need to be followed to achieve this.
I think it’s a good idea, I understand that the maker’s strategy goes in another direction, but there is a demand for dai in those chains.
It’s excited to hear Dai use and supply are increasing in L2s and mainnets. The Maker protocol should continue to expand Dai in such domains

Osmosis (Cosmos—IBC) is also making a push to onboard CanonicalDAI and CanonicalETH via the Gravity Bridge which is probably the most decentralized trustless bridge in the Planet —until the Maker Wormhole gets going
When be we setting sail for plunder an’ adventure in the Avalanche lands with Wormhole?

I was looking at AAVE on Avalance (if I remember right) and it looked like D3M to drop DAI and or USDC there would be profitable and a good place to rate manage. With hackers going after weaknesses in bridges there are some real hazards.   Liquidity fragmentation as winning chains segregate from losing chains will be interesting to watch.
